AgeUpThankYou.Title: Thank you!
AgeUpThankYou.EmailVerified: Your email address has been verified. We will be sending an email with more information on re-consent shortly after your birthday.

EmailCollected.TextPt1: An email will be sent to your child to confirm their address and tell them about the upcoming re-consent process. If you need to change the email you provided for your child, please contact the project team at

StayInformed.Title: Stay Informed!
StayInformed.Text: Thank you for joining the email list. We'll send you updates and keep you informed. You can unsubscribe at any time. If you have any questions about your status in the project, please email

JoinMailingList.Text:
Provide your email below and we'll keep you up-to-date on developments.
You can unsubscribe at any time.

SessionWillExpire.Title: Your session will time-out soon
SessionWillExpire.Text: To protect your privacy, the system is going to log you out because you have been away for a while. Click “Continue” to stay logged in. Click “Sign Out” if you are done for now.
SessionWillExpire.RenewalFailed: Session renewal failed. Please log out and log back in again.

StudyRedirect.Title: Your participation
StudyRedirect.Content:
Count Me In has an open project specific to your cancer type.

Use the button below to join the {{study}} and learn more about this existing work.

Warning.Title: Download Chrome or Safari to Continue
Warning.Text1: This project is designed for use with the internet's safest and most popular browsers -- Chrome and Safari.
Warning.Text2: It looks like you are using Internet Explorer. You will need to use another browser in order to join the project. We suggest you use Chrome or Safari to ensure that your experience with the website is smooth and secure.

Text3.Pt1: Click the following links to download
Text3.Pt3: Chrome and Safari are always free.

Error.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR: We're sorry, something went wrong. If the problem persists please contact us at support@easypost.com.
Error.NOT_ACCEPTABLE: The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities which have content characteristics not acceptable according to the accept headers sent in the request.
Error.NOT_FOUND: The requested resource could not be found.
Error.FORBIDDEN: Unable to access the requested resource.
Error.PAYMENT_REQUIRED: Insufficient funds. Please check your billing settings at http://www.easypost.com/account/billing.
Error.UNAUTHORIZED: Unable to access the requested resource, authorization failed.
Error.BAD_REQUEST: Malformed request. Please check the contents and retry.
Error.PAYMENT_GATEWAY.ERROR: The payment processor could not handle the request. Please try again or contact support@easypost.com if the problem persists.
Error.MODE.UNAUTHORIZED: This resource requires a production API Key to access.
Error.MODE.CONFLICT: API Key mode conflicted with parameter mode.
Error.DATE.PARSE.FAILURE: At least one date was formatted incorrectly and could not be parsed.
Error.PARAMETER.FORBIDDEN: The request could not be completed due to forbidden properties present in the parameters.
Error.ADDRESS.PARAMETERS.INVALID_CHARACTER: The parameters passed contained an invalid character.
Error.ADDRESS.PARAMETERS.INVALID: The parameters passed to create an Address were missing or invalid.
Error.ADDRESS.COUNTRY.INVALID: Invalid 'country', please provide a 2 character ISO country code.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFICATION.FAILURE: The address was unable to be verified.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.UNAVAILABLE: Address verification is not available. Please try again.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFICATION.INVALID: One of the verifications selected is invalid.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.CARRIER_INVALID: Unable to verify address using provided carrier.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.UPSTREAM_UNAVAILABLE: Address verification is not available due to an upstream service not responding. Please try again.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.ONLY_US: USPS can only validate US addresses.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.INTL_NOT_ENABLED: International Verification not enabled on this account. Please contact support@easypost.com.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.MISSING_STREET: Insufficient address data provided. A street must be provided.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.MISSING_CITY_STATE_ZIP: Insufficient address data provided. A city and state or a zip must be provided.
Error.E.COUNTRY.UNSUPPORTED: This country is not supported in this mode. Try in production mode.
Error.E.ENGINE.UNAVAILABLE: No verification engine is available to service this country. Please try again later.
Error.E.QUERY.UNANSWERABLE: We can not provide enough data in this country to satisfy this request. Please try again later.
Error.E.ADDRESS.NOT_FOUND: We could not find the entered address.
Error.E.SECONDARY_INFORMATION.INVALID: Invalid secondary information(Apt/Suite#). Please note, this can show up as an error on a successful request.
Error.E.SECONDARY_INFORMATION.MISSING: Missing secondary information(Apt/Suite#). Please note, this can show up as an error on a successful request.
Error.E.HOUSE_NUMBER.INVALID: We could not find the street number provided.
Error.E.ADDRESS.MULTIPLE: Multiple addresses were returned with the same zip.
Error.E.TIME_ZONE.UNAVAILABLE: The time zone service is currently unavailable.
Error.E.PO_BOX.INTERNATIONAL: Cannot verify international PO Box. Please note, this can show up as an error on a successful request.

AdminActionPanel.ActivityEdit: Click the Edit button to temporarily unlock for editing. Your edits will be saved as you go. When you click submit or navigate away, the activity will be locked again automatically.

About.Title: About Us
About.TitleText: The Leiomyosarcoma Project is part of Count Me In, a research initiative that brings together patients and scientists s partners to speed up discoveries in cancer research.
About.countMeInTopText: Count Me In is stewarded by the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute and Emerson Collective.
About.countMeInBottomText: The Osteosarcoma Project has been designed and implemented collaboratively with osteosarcoma patients, advocates, caregivers, loved ones, cancer researchers, and clinicians.
About.AdvisoryProjectSummary: The Leiomyosarcoma Project Advisory Council (PAC) is made up ofpatients, advocates, caregivers,and loved ones who have been impacted by leiomyosarcoma. The PAC meets regularly with the project operations team via video calls to develop all aspects of the project, including survey questions, the project website, the project name and logo, and sample kits.
About.AdvisorBio1: Blake Tomkinson, PhD, MBA, currently a pharmaceutical consultant in oncology, has over 25 years of experience in the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industry.  Blake has extensive research and clinical development experience in virology, immunology and oncology with expertise as a project leader, business development search and evaluation and clinical development design and strategy of small molecules, monoclonal antibodies, and peptide compounds at OSI/Gilead, Sanofi, EMD Serono/Merck KGaA and Kura Oncology. Blake also recently established the Diana’s Fibroid Foundation (DFF) with his daughters in honor of his wife, Diana Leigh Tomkinson, who passed in Feb 2020 following a four-year battle with uterine PEcoma, a rare sarcoma.  The DFF’s mission is to educate women about the potential risk of malignancy, research the underlying causes of fibroid-associated malignancies, and support early detection of malignant cells. Blake received his PhD in Immunology from the University of Massachusetts Medical School and did his post-doctoral research in molecular biology at Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Harvard Medical School.  Blake received his MBA from the University of Colorado, Denver.
About.AdvisorBio2: Cherry Kim is a Marketing Project Manager and lives in Oakland, CA with her teenage son. Her wife of 24 years, Rhonda, passed away in the fall of 2021 after battling stage 4 Uterine Leiomyosarcoma. She was Rhonda’s caretaker, cheerleader and advocate for all things, whether it was medical, insurance or home life needs. Cherry took a year off work and dedicated that time to take Rhonda on daily walks and drives around the Bay Area to bask in nature’s beauty. After seeing the successes as well as long term side effects of the various chemotherapy treatments Rhonda underwent for 2 years, Cherry was motivated to help get the LMS Project get launched to help other individuals have a stronger and longer chance of survival.
About.AdvisorBio3: Jeff was diagnosed with Leiomyosarcoma in April 2017. The initial tumor was addressed with surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation. In the Fall of 2021 he was diagnosed with a recurrence which was addressed with chemotherapy and major surgery. Jeff is eager to do whatever he can to help researchers figure out how to best help those afflicted with this disease, and perhaps one day cure it. These activities include: captain of Team Sarcoma for the Dolphins Challenge Cancer fundraising event that supports Sylvester Comprehensive Cancer Center in Miami where he has received most of his care actively supports activities of the National Leiomyosarcoma Foundation contributed live tumor tissue to pattern.org, part of the Rare Cancer Research Foundation contributed paraffin block tumor tissue to the LMS Tissue Bank at Stanford University participates in the MyPart rare tumor study Jeff’s very excited to participate on this Project Advisory Council for the leiomyosarcoma Count Me In project.
About.AdvisorBio4:
When Mary Anne was a child she contracted Polio during the last epidemic before the vaccine. She learned about advocacy by her parents who got her the best medical care at Boston Children’s Hospital. Thankfully she survived.

This cancer diagnosis shocked her, but she knew she had to educate herself about this Leiomyosarcoma. Her search led her to Dana Farber Cancer Institute where her top notch Medical Team has guided her to understand this rare cancer. ULMS now stage IV with lung and bone metastasis has taught her to maneuver the battle of a lifetime.

Early on in 2014-2015 she founded the Sarcoma Sunflower Brigade, a Facebook Support Group with four members. Now with over 2300 members the group is Stronger and Dedicated to support and knowledge sharing. Mary Anne knows Knowledge is Power! She shares a tool kit of survival skills and options like using cognitive abilities to cope, reminding ourselves to stay grounded and be grateful.

It’s hard to believe that she just recently survived a bout with covid making this her second epidemic in my 73 years! It’s more important to stay connected during this troublesome lonely time. Her two amazing sons and five precious grandchildren are her world. She stays in treatment and believes that through her resilience she is surviving and able to share hope. We are Stronger Together.
About.AdvisorBio5: Matthew Haist was diagnosed with LMS in April 2019. After a major resection of his collarbone and removal of other infected areas he had clear margins. 3 months later he had mets in my lungs. I have been doing chemo and radiation ever since. Last nodule was radiated june 2021 No evidence of new disease.
About.AdvisorBio6: Mitch is a recently retired diagnostic radiologist living in Denver.  He is a survivor of Leiomyosarcoma, diagnosed in 2011.  Since 2012 he has been an active patient advocate for all sarcomas, but especially leiomyosarcoma.  Since 2013 he has been on the Board of Directors of the National Leiomyosarcoma Foundation that is committed to patient education and support and the funding of Leiomyosarcoma specific research.  With his wife Annie in 2018, he helped to establish the NLMSF-SPAEN International LMS Research Roundtable composed of basic science sarcoma researchers, research medical and surgical sarcomas oncologists from Canada, Europe, Japan and the United States whose mission is to do research to better understand the basic science of LMS with the aim of developing novel more effective treatments for this rare cancer.  Currently, there are 120 Roundtable members.  Mitch is a member of several cancer and sarcoma organizations including the American Society of Clinical Oncology), the American Association of Cancer Research, the Connective Tissue Oncology Society,`F and the European Society for Medical Oncology and is a patient advocate for the ECOG-ACRIN Cancer Research Group and its Sarcoma Working Group. He has also been an active participant in the SARC Research Advocacy Council and the Sarcoma Coalition.
About.AdvisorBio7: Stacey Simpson Duke is a pastor, a writer, a mom of twin teenage boys, and a research advocate on the SARC Research Advocacy Council. She has been living with stage 4 leiomyosarcoma for five years. Since her diagnosis, she has been on an odyssey of self-education, becoming a voracious reader of medical research, a ferocious self-advocate, and a passionate, vocal proponent of patient empowerment. She believes that patient-researcher collaboration is key to accelerating rare cancer research and improving patient experiences and outcomes. She has found support, education, and hope through her participation in online communities and conversations, especially as a member of Leiomyosarcoma Support & Direct Research Foundation (LMSDR), and also as a learner in conversation on social media with doctors, researchers, and advanced cancer patients. Stacey is the daughter of a father who lived just 11 weeks beyond a diagnosis of angiosarcoma of the small bowel and a mother who lived 19 years beyond a stage 4 melanoma diagnosis. As such, she has witnessed the devastating limits of current medical knowledge–and the possibilities that exist beyond those limits. She is counting on the power of patient-physician-researcher partnership to propel us towards a hopeful future.
